# UITabBarController.Mode.tabSidebar

**Case**

The system displays the content as either a tab bar or a sidebar, depending on the context.

## Declaration

```swift
case tabSidebar
```

## Discussion

Different platforms handle the mode differently:

- On iPad, the system displays the content as either a tab bar or a sidebar, depending on the context.
- On Mac Catalyst, the system displays a sidebar.
- On iPhone and Apple TV, the system displays the platform’s regular tab bar.
- In visionOS, the system displays the platform’s regular tabs, but a [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITabGroup] can display a sidebar when it displays the group’s view controller.

For more information, see [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/elevating-your-ipad-app-with-a-tab-bar-and-sidebar].

## Setting modes

- **UITabBarController.Mode.automatic**: The system sets the display mode based on the tab’s content.
- **UITabBarController.Mode.tabBar**: The system displays the content only as a tab bar.
